question.text:
Match List I with List II.

List I List II
A. Mast cells I. Ciliated epithelium
B. Inner surface of bronchiole II. Areolar connective tissue
C. Blood III. Cuboidal epithelium
D. Tubular parts of nephron IV. Specialised connective tissue

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:

solution.text:
Areolar connective tissue contains macrophages, mast cells, and white blood cells.

The ciliated epithelium is found in the lining of the fallopian tubes, bronchioles, and small bronchi. The cilia are the hair-like structures that are present on the cell and help in the movement of various particles.

Specialized connective tissues include adipose, cartilage, bone, blood, and lymphatic tissues. 

The cuboidal epithelium is composed of a single layer of cube-like cells. This is commonly found in ducts of glands and tubular parts of nephrons in kidneys.

Hence, the correct answer is option D, i.e., A-II, B-I, C-IV, D-III.
